citeinfo.origin: SRP GIS Western Regional Support Center
Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands
citeinfo.title: FDAAs

descript.abstract: This layer depicts the Fire Danger Announcement Areas (FDAAs) that are used for wildland fire danger prediction using RAWS stations and SAMS sites for wind. Three Fire Danger Announcements should be made daily for FDAAs 1-3. There is no Fire Danger Announcement for FDAA 4 as there is no appreciable vegetative fuels in this area.
descript.purpose: This data layer was produced as part of the Integrated Wildland Fire Management Plan (IWFMP) for the Dugway Proving Ground 2017.
descript.supplinf:
This dataset was created in support of Task 3.3.1 SRP GIS Data Standardization, of the 2005 SRP GIS Western Regional Support Center contract. This task includes several components: installation GIS data update, installation GIS data review, installation GIS data conversion, Installation Special Map development from the resulting data, and installation GIS data return.
Installation GIS data conversion involves migration of installation datasets into an SDSFIE compliant geodatabase with the necessary attribution, relationships, metadata, and enforced topological rules.
Installation Special Map project development involves creation a standardized map project for each installation based on the RSC Installation Special Map standard and associated standardized geodatabase.
Installation data return involves the return on CD/DVD of the SDSFIE compliant personal geodatabase and the associated ArcMap document of the Installation Special Map to the installation. A comprehensive standard operating procedure (SOP) file on the steps required to maintain data in this format is also included. This standard operating procedure assists installations in keeping their datasets SDSFIE compliant.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.0 (Build 6002) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attracc.attraccr: Attribute table structure follows SDSFIE as required by DAIM-MD (AR 210-20).

dataqual.logic:
ArcGIS topology rules are for establishing and maintaining topological relationships between features. Topology was verified and needs to be edited to correct errors. Topology rules for the feature class included the following:
must not overlap
dataqual.complete: This dataset is complete as required by the SRP GIS Data Standardization task. No further work is planned at this time.

Code for a US Military Grid System quadrangle. The quadrangle is usually 6 degrees long by 8 degrees lat., but above 72 degrees N. Lat., it is 6 degrees long by 12 degrees lat. Only P and P-X are used for the Northern Hemisphere (C_H, J_N, P_X).

The adjustment factor to be applied to east coordinates to equate to the coordinate system basis.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to CDDODCMD through primary key DODCMD_ID.
Date the installation was added to the National Priorities List. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
Indicates if the installation is selected for closure (yes/no).
Date the installation was removed form the National Priorities List. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).

EPA Region Number. Number designating the EPA region within which the installation resides.
The code indicating the property use of the installation

The replacement cost of a facility, to the five-foot line, calculated in todays dollars with todays standards for design and construction. It includes supervision, inspection and overhead (SIOH) costs as well as design costs.PRV is calculated by DoD component using the OSD-developed formula as follows: PRV=(Facility Quantity X Construction Cost Factor X Area Cost Factor) X 1.2, where Facility Quantity is the Primary Unit of Measure quantity; Area Cost Factor is the adjustment applied for geographical location; and 1.2 is a 20% adjustment for SIOH and design costs.
The date the PRV was last calculated. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
The date the installation was acquired; if it was acquired. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
Indicates the Government Branch or Independent.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to CMGENPOC through primary key POC_ID.
The phone number of the security office for the military installation.
The principal purpose of functional category of the military installation.
The locally assigned designator for the division by name.
The sub-organization having control of or interest in the installation.
A boolean indicating whether or not this the presence of A/I ranges on the installation. (Y = YES and N = NP).
The abbreviated name of the Major Command.
A boolean indicating whether the presence of CTT ranges on the installation. ( Y = YES and N = NO).
The unit of measure for the complex area.
An alternate name that the installation is typically referred to as.
Managing agency of the military installation area.
Commonly used name for the installation area.
The sum of the area of the complexes on an installation.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to LSMGIGEO through primary key GNIS_ID.
The abbreviated name of the Major Subordinate Command.
The status of the installation use area.
The unit of measure for area.
The sum of the operational areas.

It includes supervision, inspection and overhead (SIOH) costs as well as design costs.PRV is calculated by DoD component using the OSD-developed formula as follows: PRV=(Facility Quantity X Construction Cost Factor X Area Cost Factor) X 1.2, where Facility Quantity is the Primary Unit of Measure quantity; Area Cost Factor is the adjustment applied for geographical location; and 1.2 is a 20% adjustment for SIOH and design costs.
The date the PRV was last calculated. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
The date the installation was acquired; if it was acquired. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
Indicates the Government Branch or Independent.

The abbreviated name of the Major Command.
A boolean indicating whether the presence of CTT ranges on the installation. ( Y = YES and N = NO).
The unit of measure for the complex area.
An alternate name that the installation is typically referred to as.

Foreign Key. Used to link the record to associated multimedia records that reference data such as imagery, video, audio, scanned documents, drawings, and other digital media.
Foreign Key. Used to link the record to the appropriate point coordinate record(s).
The date the boundary was modified or initially established. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
The reason the particular installation boundary was established representing current deed, historical, usage, or special security.
The current status of the installation boundary.
Name of the installation.
Foreign Key. Used to link the record to the subject item's address.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to CMGENAGC through primary key AGENCY_ID.
The size of the area, zone, or polygon in square units.
The unit of measure for area.
The distance around the boundary of the area, zone, or subject item in linear units.
The unit of measure for length
A description for the installation.
The parent organization of the installation.
The service component that owns the installation.
The type of military installation.

An operator defined work area. This attribute can be used by the operator for user defined system processes. It does not effect the subject item's data integrity and should not be used to store the subject item's data.
Foreign Key. Used to link the record to the Facility Record.
A numeric identification of a raster element in an image or grid that represents the feature.
The x component of individual coordinate point.
The y component of individual coordinate point.
The z component of individual coordinate point.
River mile marker.
Foreign Key. A unique, user defined identifier for each record or instance of an entity.
An actual total cost for completing the activity. Round off to nearest thousand dollars.
A description of the feature.
Path and name of the .dgn file containing a drawing or survey of the property, boundaries, etc.
Coordinate basis to which all coordinates are referenced at the installation.

Code for a US Military Grid System quadrangle. The quadrangle is usually 6 degrees long by 8 degrees lat., but above 72 degrees N. Lat., it is 6 degrees long by 12 degrees lat. Only P and P-X are used for the Northern Hemisphere (C_H, J_N, P_X).
The adjustment factor to be applied to north coordinates to equate to the coordinate system basis.
The adjustment factor to be applied to east coordinates to equate to the coordinate system basis.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to CDDODCMD through primary key DODCMD_ID.
Date the installation was added to the National Priorities List. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
Indicates if the installation is selected for closure (yes/no).
Date the installation was removed form the National Priorities List. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
EPA designation for the installation (EPA site).
EPA Region Number. Number designating the EPA region within which the installation resides.
The code indicating the property use of the installation

The replacement cost of a facility, to the five-foot line, calculated in todays dollars with todays standards for design and construction. It includes supervision, inspection and overhead (SIOH) costs as well as design costs.PRV is calculated by DoD component using the OSD-developed formula as follows: PRV=(Facility Quantity X Construction Cost Factor X Area Cost Factor) X 1.2, where Facility Quantity is the Primary Unit of Measure quantity; Area Cost Factor is the adjustment applied for geographical location; and 1.2 is a 20% adjustment for SIOH and design costs.
The date the PRV was last calculated. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
The date the installation was acquired; if it was acquired. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
Indicates the Government Branch or Independent.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to CMGENPOC through primary key POC_ID.
The phone number of the security office for the military installation.
The principal purpose of functional category of the military installation.
The locally assigned designator for the division by name.
The sub-organization having control of or interest in the installation.
A boolean indicating whether or not this the presence of A/I ranges on the installation. (Y = YES and N = NP).
The abbreviated name of the Major Command.
A boolean indicating whether the presence of CTT ranges on the installation. ( Y = YES and N = NO).
The unit of measure for the complex area.
An alternate name that the installation is typically referred to as.
Managing agency of the military installation area.
Commonly used name for the installation area.
The sum of the area of the complexes on an installation.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to LSMGIGEO through primary key GNIS_ID.
The abbreviated name of the Major Subordinate Command.
The status of the installation use area.
The unit of measure for area.
The sum of the operational areas.

enttyp.enttypd: Land and water currently owned or used by the military installation or facility

The adjustment factor to be applied to north coordinates to equate to the coordinate system basis.
The adjustment factor to be applied to east coordinates to equate to the coordinate system basis.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to CDDODCMD through primary key DODCMD_ID.
Date the installation was added to the National Priorities List. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
Indicates if the installation is selected for closure (yes/no).
Date the installation was removed form the National Priorities List. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
EPA designation for the installation (EPA site).
EPA Region Number. Number designating the EPA region within which the installation resides.
The code indicating the property use of the installation

The replacement cost of a facility, to the five-foot line, calculated in todays dollars with todays standards for design and construction. It includes supervision, inspection and overhead (SIOH) costs as well as design costs.PRV is calculated by DoD component using the OSD-developed formula as follows: PRV=(Facility Quantity X Construction Cost Factor X Area Cost Factor) X 1.2, where Facility Quantity is the Primary Unit of Measure quantity; Area Cost Factor is the adjustment applied for geographical location; and 1.2 is a 20% adjustment for SIOH and design costs.
The date the PRV was last calculated. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
The date the installation was acquired; if it was acquired. Format for date is YYYYMMDD (i.e., September 15, 1994 = 19940915).
Indicates the Government Branch or Independent.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to CMGENPOC through primary key POC_ID.
The phone number of the security office for the military installation.
The principal purpose of functional category of the military installation.
The locally assigned designator for the division by name.
The sub-organization having control of or interest in the installation.
A boolean indicating whether or not this the presence of A/I ranges on the installation. (Y = YES and N = NP).
The abbreviated name of the Major Command.
A boolean indicating whether the presence of CTT ranges on the installation. ( Y = YES and N = NO).
The unit of measure for the complex area.
An alternate name that the installation is typically referred to as.
Managing agency of the military installation area.
Commonly used name for the installation area.
The sum of the area of the complexes on an installation.
FOREIGN KEY - Links the record to LSMGIGEO through primary key GNIS_ID.
The abbreviated name of the Major Subordinate Command.
The status of the installation use area.
The unit of measure for area.
The sum of the operational areas.

distinfo.distliab:
The SRP GIS Western Regional Support Center is operated by the Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands (CEMML), a research and service unit at Colorado State University. CEMML provides these geographic data "as is." Although proper GIS data development procedures have been followed in accordance with Federal and Industry standards, CEMML makes no guarantees or warranties, either expressed or implied, concerning the accuracy of any information contained or any other matter whatsoever, including, without limitation, the condition of the product, or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. See source data or conduct field surveys for the most accurate portrayal of any data layer. Although these data have been processed successfully on computers of CEMML, no warranty, expressed or implied, is made by CEMML regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.
In no event shall CEMML have any liability whatsoever for payment of any consequential, incidental, indirect, special, or tort damages of any kind, including, but not limited to, any loss of profits arising out of use of or reliance on the geographic data or arising out of the delivery, installation, operation, or support by CEMML.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: This data layer was produced as part of the Integrated Wildland Fire Management Plan (IWFMP) for the Dugway Proving Ground 2017.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: This layer depicts the Fire Danger Announcement Areas (FDAAs) that are used for wildland fire danger prediction using RAWS stations and SAMS sites for wind. Three Fire Danger Announcements should be made daily for FDAAs 1-3. There is no Fire Danger Announcement for FDAA 4 as there is no appreciable vegetative fuels in this area.
